snippet: Ninety-nine percent of human deaths are caused by dog bites, with India having the most rabies deaths — almost 21,000 a year.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Neglected Tropical Diseases finds that rabies kills 59,000 people a year, higher than previously thought; mass vaccination of dogs is cheapest and most effective way to prevent disease.
lead_paragraph: Ninety-nine percent of human deaths are caused by dog bites, with India having the most rabies deaths — almost 21,000 a year.

headline.print_headline: Rabies Deaths Higher Than Previously Thought
headline.main: Rabies Deaths Higher Than Previously Thought
